intro: Ouratea venulata, commonly known as the white sylph, is a species of flowering plant in the family Annonaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of Central and South America, where it thrives in humid, shaded environments. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, white flowers that bloom in clusters. Its fruits are follicles that release seeds when mature, contributing to its propagation. The botanical features of Ouratea venulata make it an important component of the understory vegetation in tropical forests.
